titleStmt.title: Saul smitten to the ground being a brief, but faithful narrative of the dying remorse of a late living enemy (to the people called Quakers, and their faith and worship), Matthew Hide : attested by eye and ear-witnesses, whereof his widdow is one ... : with an appendix both to foes and friends on this occasion / by William Penn.
titleStmt.author: Penn, William, 1644-1718.
Hide, Matthew, d. 1675.

notesStmt.note: "To all atheistical persecuting and contentious opposers of the universal light of Jesus in the consciences" (p. 7-16) signed: W.P.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
